page.title: 03Farming(cont.)
page.content: of the country.Cereal crops,especially barley and wheat grow best where the annual rain-fall is under 750mm,with spring showers and a warm sunny dry harvest period.The climate of the fens is especially suitable for these crops. Average July temperatures are around 17c whick enables crops to ripen well. The winters are fairly cold with rather mean january temperatures whick are normaly between 3c & 5c.Although the frost and cold help break up the soil and ill the pests.There is the disavantage that the frost heaving of the soil occasionally exposes and breaks the stems of the wheat sown in the Autumn. increasingly therefore spring wheat is being grown. This also means farmers can grow late maturing crops like carrots and main
